page.title: 01GENERAL SURVEY OF THE AREA
page.content: Viewing our area from its north western extremity-Hanley City Centre-the panorama eastwards and southwards presents an immediate, and we feel, unique mix; that is modern shops, high-rise flats, Victorian Terraces, through areas of green space to rough grazing lands which surround post war housing estates. Industrial premises of various ages and types are interspersed throughout the area and Hanley itself has become the recognised commercial and cultural centre for the city of Stoke-on-Trent. The following pages try to give information about and impressions of this disparate area which covers Hanley,Northwood,parts of Shelton and Fenton,the outlying surburb of Bucknall,Townsend, and adjacent housing estates of Bentilee Berry Hill and Eaton Park.Most of the writing has been done by schoolchildren
